wikipedia_page.main:
Thomas Henry Rust (3 March 1881 – 9 August 1962) was an English cricketer.  Rust was a right-handed batsman. He was born at Gloucester, Gloucestershire.
Rust made a single first-class appearance for Gloucestershire against Lancashire at the Spa Ground, Gloucester, in the 1914 County Championship.  Batting first, Gloucestershire made 155, with Rust being run out after scoring 2 runs.  Lancashire responded by making 394 in their first-innings, while Gloucestershire were dismissed for 206 in their second-innings, with Rust being dismissed for a duck by Bill Huddleston.  Lancashire won the match by an innings and 33 runs.Rust also had a distinguished local football career, playing and captaining Gloucester City 62 times from 1898-1907, scoring 41 goals.He died at Tredworth, Gloucestershire on 9 August 1962.
